result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI - 5th [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and Operating w/ PAC - 5th [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI - 5th [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC - 5th [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device] was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert Allen Moe was found guilty of OWI - 5th [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Barry Curtis Lundeen DF: Robert Allen Moe appeared. Case called at 2:18. ADA Hartung updates the court. Atty. Lundeen agrees. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CF221. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. DE acknowledges priors. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 15CF221. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2,3,4 in 15CF221. Ex. #1 statement from Hudson Hospital. Atty's waive a PSI. DE makes statement. Sentencing arguments. Court waives PSI. Crt orders:
Sentence W/H
3 years probation with conditions:
- 9 months condition time to be served by electronic monitoring
  Good time granted. 
  1 day credit against any ultimate sentence. 
- $1500.00 
- Costs of $268.00
- $52.00 restitution for blood draw
 - Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $250.00
   Apply bond on file. 
- 36 months DL revocation
  credit for administrative suspension.
- 36 months IID
- AODA and driver's safety plan
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  
- Random and regular testing.
- Victim impact panel through restorative justice.  

DE to report to probation today. 
Court will authorize a furlough through electronic monitoring for DE to attend graduation ceremony for his daughter. 
DE remanded.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
